title: Drawing, Page of a sketchbook; Scenes of Apollonius, ca. 1590
title_raw: Page of a sketchbook; Scenes of Apollonius
medium: Bistre pen and ink, gray wash on paper
inscribed: Middle: Uno giovano spiritate in atene in grehia; Bottom: Uno sapiento a Roma apolioni fece Resusitare una frusiula da morte; Recto, middle: Una dona partori un figlio co 3 capi
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description:
Vertical format. Verso - top: Interior - figure seated on a dais, right, others seated and standing before him. Image on pedastal, left foreground. Below - an attempt to revive a stricken person, lying on an open litter in the public square. Surrounded by a crowd. Recto - top: Interior, with a group of women assisting at a birth; below, an army marching toward left. Spectators watch at right.

Verso title: Apollonius Predicting the Year of the Three Emperors in Syracuse (top); Apollonius Predicting the Acquittal of a Man Condemned to Death in Alexandria (bottom)

Recto title: Apollonius Curing a Young Athenian Possessed of a Demon (top); Apollonius Raising a Girl from the Dead in Rome (bottom)

participants.person_name: Jan van der Straet, called Stradanus

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Page of a sketchbook; Scenes of Apollonius, ca. 1590. Bistre pen and ink, gray wash on paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2022
